intro: Geraniospermum glechomodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and have a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or red, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Geraniospermum glechomodes is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact size.
